definition: variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
to advise/to urge/to try to persuade/to exhort/to console/to soothe
to guard against/to exhort/to admonish or warn/to give up or stop doing sth/Buddhist monastic discipline/ring (for a finger)

sentences.english: Minister rushed about the camp praying and exhorting.
sentences.chinese: 牧师在营地到处奔走，一边祷告，一边劝戒。

sentences.english: Admonish your friends in private, praise them in public. (pron. )
sentences.chinese: 对朋友私下劝戒，公开表扬。

sentences.english: The ear that heareth the reproofs of life, shall abide in the midst of the wise.
sentences.chinese: 喜听有益生命劝戒的人，必得列于智慧人的中间。

sentences.english: She had abandoned all attempts at remonstrance with Thomas.
sentences.chinese: 她已经放弃了一切劝戒托马斯的尝试。

sentences.english: These things speak, and exhort, and rebuke with all authority.
sentences.chinese: 这些事你要讲明，劝戒人，用各等权柄责备人。

sentences.english: She expostulated with her husband on his habit of smoking in bed.
sentences.chinese: 她劝戒丈夫改掉在床上吸烟的习惯。

sentences.english: But ye have set at nought all my counsel, and would none of my reproof
sentences.chinese: 反轻弃我一切的劝戒，不肯受我的责备。

sentences.english: Admonish your friends in private, praise them in public.
sentences.chinese: 对朋友私下劝戒，公开表扬。

definition: variant of 警戒[jing3 jie4]/to warn
to advise and teach/to persuade and instruct
variant of 告誡|告诫[gao4 jie4]
variant of 訓誡|训诫[xun4 jie4]
to repeatedly advise sb earnestly (idiom)/to admonish
to exhort (sb) to live a virtuous life (Buddhism)/to beg for alms
lesson from events of the past/warning
